item.title: LEGO Fortnite Odyssey: How to Get Cursed Bones
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Get Cursed Bones
  • How To Use Cursed Bones
    • Building The Rune Forge
    • Crafting Cursed Weapons
    • Crafting Better Charms

LEGO Fortnite Odyssey throws players into a wide-open sandbox experience, where they are given the freedom to explore a range of different biomes and islands, build a Village, and try their luck battling elite enemies that pack a punch. In survival, players' skills will truly be put to the test, especially if they want to traverse through the harsher biomes to establish villages in other corners of the map.

Of course, to progress through LEGO Fortnite Odyssey , players will need to upgrade their gear, and to do that, players will need resources. There are a ton of different resources that players will need to stockpile, from Granite to even lucrative gems like Ruby and Emeralds. However, one of the most sought-after has to be Cursed Bones.

How To Get Cursed Bones

To get Cursed Bones, players will need to slay Bone Wolves. Bone Wolves can be found in pretty much every biome , making acquiring Cursed Bones relatively straightforward. However, they only come out at night.

Bone Wolves themselves are relatively easy to take down, only requiring a weapon of rare rarity or higher to make short work of them. However, they are pretty swift and can pack a punch if players are not careful, so bringing along a shield for combat is also recommended.

Once defeated, a Bone Wolf will drop the following items:

  • 1 Cursed Bone
  • 4 Wolf Claws

How To Use Cursed Bones

Building The Rune Forge

Cursed Bones are a resource used for crafting and building in LEGO Fortnite. Their primary function is to build the Rune Forge , a Utility Station that players can use to apply Runes to their weapons, bestowing them with a range of different effects. To build the Rune Forge, players will need the following resources:

  • 10 Granite Slabs
  • 6 Glass
  • 4 Cursed Bones

Once players have all these resources on hand, they can build the Rune Forge via the Build Menu.

Crafting Cursed Weapons

Cursed Bones can also be used to craft uncommon Cursed Weapons and tools at the Crafting Bench. Cursed Weapons each come with Undead Bane II equipped , which increases damage dealt to undead enemies. This can be great when applied to swords, daggers, and crossbows, especially if players regularly battle Skeletons at night.

To craft a Cursed Tool, have the Cursed Bones on hand and head to a Crafting Bench. Players can then select the tool they want to craft and, under resources, select the Cursed Bones.

Crafting Better Charms

Aside from building the Rune Forge and crafting Cursed Weapons, the most sought-after use for Cursed Bones is to craft Charms. There are a handful of Charms that use Cursed Bones in their recipes, each providing different benefits. Here is a quick breakdown of the Charms that can be crafted using Cursed Bones:

Charm

Crafting Recipe

Totem of Return (Uncommon)

  • 50 Storm Core
  • 5 of any Thread
  • 12 of any Slab
  • 3 Cursed Bone

Totem of the Immortal (Rare)

  • 3 Cord
  • 5 Copper Bar
  • 5 Blast Core
  • 3 Cursed Bone

Hearty Totem (Rare)

  • 3 Wool Thread
  • 3 Cursed Bone
  • 5 Copper Bar
  • 2 Bear Pelt

item.description: Players secure eliminations with random grenades and other accidental wins.

item.title: Every Pokemon TCG Pocket Card Added With Mythical Island Explained
item.description:
Pokemon TCG Pocket has just expanded its growing meta with the release of the mobile game's first themed booster pack, Mythical Island. Following up on the comparatively large Genetic Apex expansion that previously dropped, this Mew-centric set of new cards is filled with new representatives for every rarity in Pokemon TCG Pocket .

While it mostly consists of common cards likely to be found in Regular packs, the Rare "God Packs" which have a low percentage chance of being pulled can show off just how many EXs have been added in Pokemon TCG Pocket 's Mythical Island booster. Between powerful Pokemon and Support options alike, these 86 cards are set to redefine the competitive landscape of deck building until the next release.

The Rare Pulls of Mythical Island

Mew EX Leads God Packs

With 18 out of the 86 cards in the set being classified as "Super Rares", there's a decent chance of adding one of these important cards to the collection. The likes of one of the best Grass-type cards in Pokemon TCG Pocket , Celebi EX, are worth building entire decks around due to their high damage potential in one turn.

Support Cards and Other New EXs

With the synergy of new Support cards like Budding Expeditioner with its effect of being able to help get Mew EX on the field quickly, several of these rare Pokemon TCG Pocket pulls are likely to form vital components of new decks made around their interactions.

The rest of what fills the Mew Pack largely serves to flesh out the new game, but cards like Scolipede have the potential to lead an effective Poison gimmick that can compete with the best decks in Pokemon TCG Pocket 's Genetic Apex expansion.

item.title: Animal Crossing: Pocket Camp Complete - What to Do with Perfect Fruit
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Where to Find Perfect Fruit
    • How Often Does Fruit Spawn
  • Should You Sell Perfect Fruit?
    • How to Turn In Requests Using Perfect Fruit

Fruit is a category of collected items you can get in Animal Crossing: Pocket Camp Complete . You'll need them for completing animal requests, but you can sell them for Bells if you need. Pocket Camp Complete also has a type of fruit called "Perfect Fruit." As the name would suggest, they're much rarer than regular fruit, and despite their limited uses, they're still worth making room for in the inventory.

Where to Find Perfect Fruit

How Often Does Fruit Spawn

Fruit can be gathered by knocking them down from fruit trees in Pocket Camp Complete . They will always spawn in bundles of three per tree. Once you shake them from the tree, it will take 3 hours for fruit to grow back. You can find fruit at the following areas:

Type of Fruit

Location (x No. of trees)

Sells for

Peach

  • Lost Lure Creek (x1)
  • Breezy Hollow (x1)

  • Regular :
    • 10 Bells

  • Perfect :
    • 600 Bells

* Lychee

  • Lost Lure Creek (x1)
  • Breezy Hollow (x1)

  • Regular :
    • 10 Bells (Local)
    • 600 Bells (Non-Local)

  • Perfect :
    • 600 Bells (Local)
    • 3000 Bells (Non-Local)

Cherry

  • Lost Lure Creek (x1)
  • Breezy Hollow (x1)

  • Regular :
    • 10 Bells

  • Perfect :
    • 600 Bells

Apple

  • Breezy Hollow (x1)

  • Regular :
    • 10 Bells

  • Perfect :
    • 600 Bells

Pear

  • Breezy Hollow (x1)

  • Regular :
    • 10 Bells

  • Perfect :
    • 600 Bells

Orange

  • Breezy Hollow (x1)

  • Regular :
    • 10 Bells

  • Perfect :
    • 600 Bells

Coconut

  • Sunburst Island (x1)
  • Saltwater Shores (x2)

  • 10 Bells

* Grapes

  • Lost Lure Creek (x1)
  • Breezy Hollow (x1)

  • Regular :
    • 10 Bells (Local)
    • 600 Bells (Non-Local)

  • Perfect :
    • 600 Bells (Local)
    • 3000 Bells (Non-Local)

* Lemon

  • Lost Lure Creek (x1)
  • Breezy Hollow (x1)

  • Regular :
    • 10 Bells (Local)
    • 600 Bells (Non-Local)

  • Perfect :
    • 600 Bells (Local)
    • 3000 Bells (Non-Local)

* Lychee, Grapes, and Lemon are considered "local" fruits in Pocket Camp Complete . Your version of Pocket Camp Complete may have a lychee tree while someone else has a lemon tree instead. If you get a fruit that you can't get from the above-mentioned locations, then you should sell it. Selling non-local fruit will give you 600 Bells.

If there is a Perfect Fruit, one of the three fruits on a tree will be a different color. For example, Perfect Peaches are gold; Perfect Lychee Berries are red. Perfect Fruit are considered Collected Items just as regular fruit, but they take up a separate inventory slot. Be sure you have some room before shaking Perfect Fruit from trees.

You can eliminate the cooldown on fruit trees by using Fertilizer .

Another way to get Perfect Fruit is to set a Camp Caretaker . Your Camp Caretaker will complete different quests or partake in events and give whatever they collect as a gift. You'll be able to tell a Camp Caretaker has something for you by the icon in the lower-right corner of your Map. Alternatively, if you have your Camp Caretaker to walk with you, you can collect any rewards when they have a thought bubble over their head.

Should You Sell Perfect Fruit?

How to Turn In Requests Using Perfect Fruit

If you have any Perfect Fruit, you can either sell it or use it to turn in animal requests. Every three hours, the animals appearing on the map will switch out with another animal. When this happens, you can speak to them during the 3-hour period to build up friendship.

If you're using Pete's Parcel Service, you can complete requests without having to jump to different areas.

An animal may ask for fruit ("Sounds like they want some fruit!"), which will prompt you to give them a piece of fruit directly from your inventory. You can give them regular fruits, but if you give them a Perfect Fruit , you'll receive more crafting materials and 1500 Bells as a reward. If you're really lucky, you may even obtain a Fortune Cookie.

If you'd rather sell Perfect Fruit, you can do so from your bag:

  1. Select the Luggage icon over the Craft icon at the bottom of your screen.
  2. Scroll down to fruit in your Collected Items pouch, and find the Perfect Fruit you want to sell.
  3. Select Sell and choose how many you want to get rid of.

Your local Perfect Fruit will sell for 600 Bells . If you sell a non-local Perfect Fruit, the price will be 3000 Bells .

It's better to give local Perfect Fruit to animals in the "give fruit" requests. The 1500 Bells is better than selling them outright for 600 Bells. If you have non-local Perfect Fruit, you should sell it for the 3000 Bells.

item.title: Rumor: Another Switch 2 Accessory Has Leaked Online
item.description:
Summary

  • A new Nintendo Switch 2 accessory leaked online, turning a Joy-Con into a steering wheel for immersive gameplay.
  • Nintendo Switch 2 is expected to be revealed by March 2025.
  • Fans think the accessory leak could tease Mario Kart 9 being a launch title for the upcoming system. However, nothing has been confirmed.

A new Nintendo Switch 2 accessory has leaked online, which turns the Joy-Cons into a steering wheel, possibly allowing players to get a much more immersive experience for games involving driving vehicles. Previously, a few cases for the Nintendo Switch 2 were also leaked, which gave fans a comprehensive overview of what the console could look like.

The Nintendo Switch is all set to complete its eighth anniversary early next year, and fans are growing increasingly impatient over the release of the next console. While an official release date hasn't been confirmed yet, Nintendo did state that the Nintendo Switch 2 will be revealed in this fiscal year, which is slated to end in March 2025. Some fans believe that the Switch 2 will be released on the Switch's eighth anniversary which happens to be on March 7, 2025, but nothing has been confirmed. Amid that, some possible details have emerged about an accessory for the console.

In a new tweet, popular Nintendo leaker Pory reveals a possible accessory for Nintendo Switch 2. The tweet features a couple of pictures of an alleged steering wheel accessory for the Nintendo Switch 2 Joy-Cons, along with a single controller grip. The picture gives a much better overview of what the new Joy-Cons could look like with the accessories, and fans seem to like certain aspects of the design. In addition, it seems like fans think they have received a hint about the possible release date of Mario Kart 9 with this leak.

Nintendo Switch 2 Joy-Con Steering Wheel Sparks Mario Kart 9 Rumors

Fans believe that the presence of a steering wheel accessory suggests that Mario Kart 9 could be a launch title for Nintendo Switch 2. Considering that Mario Kart 8 Deluxe came out on the Nintendo Switch all the way back in 2017, the community has been waiting for a sequel for quite a while now. Fans have a lot of expectations from Mario Kart 9 , ranging from new characters to modes, tracks, and much more. That being said, there has been no official word about Mario Kart 9 being a launch title yet, so all of this should be taken with a grain of salt.

As far as the design is concerned, fans seem to like that the leaked steering wheel adopts a layout similar to a real one. The previous Joy-Con steering wheel only features a circular design with the Joy-Con in the middle, but this one seems much more intricate with a partition in the lower part. This might give players a much better grip on the steering wheel. With Nintendo Switch 2 Joy-Con leaks already suggesting some interesting changes coming up for the controller, it will be interesting to see what other accessories surface in the near future.
